name: asceticism
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the practice of living a simple life without physical pleasures, often for religious reasons: He believed a closer relationship with God could be found through strict asceticism. It seems unfair to judge her by the asceticism of the office that she moved into less than six months ago. See
ascetic
More examplesFewer examplesAt one time he argued for a culture of asceticism and socialist revolutionary philosophy.As a form of asceticism, celibacy is more at home with a hermit in the desert or a monk in a monastery.For all the asceticism of his work, he’s a man who loves to be photographed and to wear good tweed and leather. Her asceticism was assumed to carry with it supernatural ability, and eventually she became famous.
